intro: Babiana socotrana, commonly known as the Socotra starling orchid, is a unique plant native to the island of Socotra. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Iridaceae family, characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces bright yellow or orange blooms. It thrives in the arid and rocky environments of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
